result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin G Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevin G Anderson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kevin G Anderson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin G Anderson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Clerk to Defendant re: Court-ordered Payment Arrangements

1:06 pm
No Appearance by Defendant.  Defendant has made payment arrangements.  Court orders Warrant - stayed, pending compliance with Payment Plan Agreement.
Court adjourned at 1:06 pm

No Contact provision of bond has been cancelled.
43

9:52 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Erik Johnson.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 2 with a fine and costs.  DA concurs.  Atty Johnson concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2 Disorderly Conduct.  Court orders count 1 be dismissed outright.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Johnson.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  $100 fine plus court costs - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Court adjourned at 9:57 a.m.

9:21 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Erik Johnson present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Johnson - case is resolved and pending on defendant completing community service.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on November 23, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Corut adjourned at 9:22 a.m.
for Leave to File Additional Motions

11:15 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Erik Johnson.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court has allowed Atty Privat to withdraw.  Statement by Atty Johnson - believes that Atty Haase has been appointed.  Atty Johnson makes statement - has been privately retained.  Further statement by Atty Johnson - believes that competency is not an issue.  Statement by the Court in regards to competency - if the court feels in the future or defendant does not cooperate, then the court may order treatment.  Court will set for Status Hearing on October 12, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:18 a.m.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: to counsel with a copy of a letter from Dr Craig Schoenecker MD
from Dr Craig Schoenecker dated August 21, 2015
Fax Cover Sheet to Wisconsin Forensic Unit (Faxed 3:30 p.m.)

11:00 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has some concerns about competency and possible withdrawl as attorney.  Court sets for Status Hearing on September 15, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.  Court orders a competency evaluation be completed.

Court adjourned at 11:57 a.m.

11:44 a.m  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has an offer and has heard defednant will not accept the offer and requests an adjournment.  Court sets for Status Hearing on August 4, 2015 at 11:00 A.M.

Court adjourned at 11:44 a.m.

11:07 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat, has received Discovery and need to pretrial with DA.  Court will set for plea & sentencing on June 23, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:08 a.m.

1:15 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - has been trying to get a hold of the public defender.  Court will set for status hearing on April 20, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:16 p.m.

No Contact with Joseph S.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

No Contact with Joseph S.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

2:27 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Joseph S.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Court will set for Status Hearing on April 6, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:29 p.m.
